alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 7:14PM EDT until August 15 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Union County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain in the Unionville area will cause rapid rises on small tributaries to Crooked Creek and Richardson Creek. Flooding of low lying areas near the creeks will be possible this evening, especially around Secrest Shortcut, Unionville-Indian Trail Road, Lawyers Rd, and Sikes Mill Road near Love Mill Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since mid-afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Unionville and Fairview In Union County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
